item.title: Libertine add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. " -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Too much of a good thing can be wonderful!" -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Those who are easily shocked should be shocked more often." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "It's not the men in your life that matters, it's the life in your men." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "There are no good girls gone wrong - just bad girls found out." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I used to be Snow White, but I drifted." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Marriage is a fine institution, but I'm not ready for an institution." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "To err is human - but it feels divine." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Don't cry for a man who's left you--the next one may fall for your smile." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Keep a diary and one day it'll keep you." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "One more drink and I'll be under the host." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I never worry about diets. The only carrots that interest me are the number you get in a diamond." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Men are my hobby, if I ever got married I'd have to give it up." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in moderation, including moderation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Good women are no fun... The only good woman I can recall in history was Betsy Ross. And all she ever made was a flag." -- Mae West

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Libertine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain
